docs.lead_paragraph: El Salvador's Congress on Wednesday pardoned a woman accused of abortion and later sentenced to 30 years in prison for homicide in a landmark case that has put the country's harsh laws under the spotlight.

headline.main: El Salvador Woman Jailed Over Abortion Pardoned by Congress
headline.print_headline: El Salvador Woman Jailed Over Abortion Pardoned by Congress

docs.snippet: El Salvador's Congress on Wednesday pardoned a woman accused of abortion and later sentenced to 30 years in prison for homicide in a landmark case that has put the country's harsh laws under the spotlight.

docs.lead_paragraph: Republican leaders in the U.S. House of Representatives, facing a revolt from female Republicans in the chamber, dropped plans on Wednesday night for a vote on a bill that would ban abortion after 20 weeks of pregnancy, according to media reports.

headline.main: U.S. House Republicans Drop Vote on Abortion Bill: Report
headline.print_headline: U.S. House Republicans Drop Vote on Abortion Bill: Report

docs.snippet: Republican leaders in the U.S. House of Representatives, facing a revolt from female Republicans in the chamber, dropped plans on Wednesday night for a vote on a bill that would ban abortion after 20 weeks of pregnancy, according to media reports.

docs.lead_paragraph: Buoyed by conservative gains in the November election, foes of abortion are mobilizing on behalf of bills in several state legislatures that would further curtail women's access to the procedure.

headline.main: Abortion Opponents Push New Bills in State Legislatures
headline.print_headline: Abortion Opponents Push New Bills in State Legislatures

docs.snippet: Buoyed by conservative gains in the November election, foes of abortion are mobilizing on behalf of bills in several state legislatures that would further curtail women's access to the procedure.

docs.lead_paragraph: In an embarrassing setback, House Republicans abruptly decided Wednesday to drop planned debate of a bill criminalizing virtually all late-term abortions after objections from GOP women and other lawmakers left them short of votes.

headline.main: House GOP Abruptly Drops Plans to Debate Abortion Bill
headline.print_headline: House GOP Abruptly Drops Plans to Debate Abortion Bill

docs.snippet: In an embarrassing setback, House Republicans abruptly decided Wednesday to drop planned debate of a bill criminalizing virtually all late-term abortions after objections from GOP women and other lawmakers left them short of votes.

docs.lead_paragraph: Republicans rejected most of the proposals in President Obama’s State of the Union address, saying he is unwilling to compromise.

headline.main: Republicans Have One Word for President’s Proposals and Veto Threats: ‘No’
headline.print_headline: Republicans Have One Word for President’s Proposals and Veto Threats: ‘No’

docs.abstract: Republicans spurn proposals made by Pres Obama during his State of Union address, blaming him for alleged unwillingness to work with them to pass bipartisan legislation.
docs.snippet: Republicans rejected most of the proposals in President Obama’s State of the Union address, saying he is unwilling to compromise.

byline.original: By JEREMY W. PETERS and EMMARIE HUETTEMAN

docs.lead_paragraph: In saying that Roman Catholics should not feel compelled to breed “like rabbits,” the pope set a new standard for the papal vernacular, amusing to some and insulting to others.

headline.main: Pope Amuses and Insults With Remark on Parenting
headline.print_headline: Pope Amuses and Insults With Remark on Parenting

docs.abstract: Pope Francis remarks that Catholics should not feel compelled to breed 'like rabbits,' amusing some people and insulting others; says Catholics should practice responsible parenthood while remaining mindful of church's views on contraception.
docs.snippet: In saying that Roman Catholics should not feel compelled to breed “like rabbits,” the pope set a new standard for the papal vernacular, amusing to some and insulting to others.

docs.abstract: My pregnancy’s viability is still very much in limbo. As am I. I am readying myself for whatever happens, but I am split in a way I have never felt before.
docs.snippet: My pregnancy’s viability is still very much in limbo. As am I. I am readying myself for whatever happens, but I am split in a way I have never felt before.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama is vowing to veto a Republican-backed bill that would ban abortions after the first 20 weeks of pregnancy, as well as a measure that would require a decision on pipeline construction within 12 months.

headline.main: Obama Vows to Veto GOP-Backed Abortion, Pipeline Bills
headline.print_headline: Obama Vows to Veto GOP-Backed Abortion, Pipeline Bills

docs.snippet: President Barack Obama is vowing to veto a Republican-backed bill that would ban abortions after the first 20 weeks of pregnancy, as well as a measure that would require a decision on pipeline construction within 12 months.

headline.main: Meeting the Baby, Becoming a Family

docs.abstract: From the moment we met our daughter, weighing two-and-a-half pounds and wearing a red bow pasted on her head, we could tell she was the fighter and “rock star” we’d been told about.
docs.snippet: From the moment we met our daughter, weighing two-and-a-half pounds and wearing a red bow pasted on her head, we could tell she was the fighter and “rock star” we’d been told about.

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. Open finalist Kei Nishikori of Japan paid tribute to Li Na, describing her as an inspiration for Asian tennis.
